episode_summary: This episode features a variety of quirky and intriguing facts, including the origins of sausages, the peculiarities of NASCAR headlights, the massive data traffic through a Virginia county, and the unique celebration of Frozen Dead Guy Days in Colorado.

facts.fact: The first sausages were supposedly invented by Emperor Nero's cook, Gayas, who discovered them when a pig's intestine puffed up due to heat after the pig had been starved.
NASCAR cars don't have real headlights; they use stickers to simulate them because the races are either during the day or under floodlights, so functional headlights are unnecessary.
Loudoun County in Virginia supposedly handles 70% of the world's online traffic due to its large concentration of data centers.
Frozen Dead Guy Days is an annual celebration in Nederland, Colorado, where they honor a man who was cryogenically frozen by his family and kept in a shed.
